sMn58wh0YFAD6ybQlwjmFQ.text: Employees Only is one of the few cocktail bars in the Tanjong Pagar area that's open on Sundays. As with most fancy cocktail places in Singapore, drinks here run for about $25++ each. I enjoyed the Ready Fire Aim cocktail, a refreshing and smoky mezcal-based concoction with pineapple and lime. If you enjoy lavender, go for the Provençal cocktail, which has a strong floral profile balanced with a heavy measure of gin.Be warned that this bar can get quite noisy. It's probably not the place to visit if you're looking for a quiet place to grab a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Employees Only - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Employees Only - Singapore, Singapore

MJoD5rsoE3hzEhThvN29hw.text: A fast paced but still chill bistro. A fabulous selection of drink mixology with a nice food menu on top. Break out your wallet, as drinks will run at 20+$, but I don't feel cheated on the quality, quantity or originality. Try the West Side or Ginger Smash. For good, we started with the Spicy Crispy Prawns. They were a bit of Singapore meets LA.  Spicy yet sophisticated. Dinner was the Porterhouse Pork Chop.  Perfectly prepared and presented. Service was fast and professional. Will return

CFyzusjX-0rwhz8neIQNzg.text: When I first moved to Singapore I was pretty surprised to see the craft cocktail scene JUST starting to heat up.  After all, craft cocktails had been going strong in the US for years and years, so it was like going back in time.  Nonetheless, when I heard Employees Only was making its way to town, I was definitely excited, as I had been to the NY location, and I knew without a doubt it was going to be done well.   I was right.  I've been to Employees Only twice, once on a date, and once with a friend.  The first time was packed wall to wall with young pretty something expats and locals on dates, groups, and trying to hit the town.  The place is trendy no doubt, and the ever so handsome bartenders def. know what they are doing, which I appreciate.  The second time was a little strange, as a mid 30 something I was the youngest person there, which I didn't mind, as that rarely happens in Singapore.  The music is always on point, and either way, the vibe is cool.   As far as the cocktails go, yes, they are expensive, but what in Singapore isn't.  I've had one of the ginger smash, excellent, some champagne cocktail I believe, and a Manhattan, which was easily one of the best I've had.  They also have food which I wasn't aware of, so perhaps next time I'll try dinner.  Def. a nice date place, or stop in for a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Employees Only - Singapore, Singapore. Super busy bar, but killer, cute bartenders, who really know their stuff

WfgQ1e4MtZYjuimd-GjWQg.text: This place is totally fun and a great place to get your drink on. The cocktails are all great, the best part about this place is the bartenders and the music. So fun, so sexy!

photos.caption: Photo of Employees Only - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Employees Only - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Employees Only - Singapore, Singapore. Just like the NYC home base, I love this sign.

iRNB9irWKGO4gribozUERQ.text: Good cocktails, good service, mediocre food.Went for dinner on a Saturday night. The cocktails were well made and satisfying, the appetizers were even quite good, but the entrees were underwhelming and uninspired. Note, the food was cooked well, but for the price, I expected more flavor, better presentation, something more. Would go back, but only to have a couple drinks or an appetizer - so many places in Singapore to have a nice meal with better value for the price - hence the 2 stars.  Recommend making a reservation for a table if you want drinks - walking out, the bar was overwhelmingly packed, could barely walk out. Also, the staff was quite nice and attentive despite being very busy.Food:Steak Tartar - really really good. The final mix of ingredients is done at the table and tailored to your preference. highly recommendBone marrow poppers - pretty good, but would rather get two steak tartarsPork chop - Juicy and well cooked, but lacked flavor. Comes with black eyed peas which were nice, but I didn't care for the combination.Trout - Cooked very nicely, but I thought it lacked seasoning or flavor. Comes with a frisse which was really really good.Kale - side. Sauteed with a little garlic, good, but pretty standardDrinks:Manhattan - very goodGinger smash - nice and refreshing

Amk8oh8QE9tuq73Tt2Y8qA.text: The best cocktail bar in the city, with killer food to match. Bar none! Come here if you want to have an epic night. Come here if you want to have a low key dinner. Truly perfect for both and anything in between.

cWiHr0FtiwLWEOWWMv6KLg.text: The drinks here are amazing. I loved everything I ordered!!! Even though they could cheat and pre-mix their drinks, they don't do that so everything comes out tasting fresh and amazing. When I wasn't very inspired by the menu and ordered some classic cocktails, they also added their own twist to them and they were absolutely delicious. I've tried:- Fraise Sauvage: perfect for someone who loves refreshing drinks - extremely delicious- Provencal: super interesting with savory notes from the herbes de provence, loved it!- Ready Fire Aim: did not expect to love this because of the mezcal, but they balanced out the smokiness really well- Red Dawn: delicious and didn't have the earthiness from the beetroot at all- Mata Hari: so. yummy. The pomegranate juice really adds a delicious touch- Ginger Smash: refreshing- Negroni (single glass, not on the menu): super well balanced, very good version of this classic drink- Aviation (not on the menu): absolutely delicious! They added their own twist to it and I loved it- Corpse Reviver (not on the menu): delicious but I preferred other versions I've had- Daily Daisy: this was a frozen Sangria when I visited recently, it's deliciously spiced and not too strongThe food here is also pretty good for a bar - not exactly the only reason I'd visit but they were delicious. The skate wing is a specialty here and tastes great with the paprika sauce and spaetzle.The service is great if you're at the bar and only have to deal with the bartender. If you're seated at a table, the service can be slow because the servers are super busy.If you make a reservation, you'll have to sit at a table away from the bar since the bar is walk-in only. Also, if it were up to me, I'd only visit in the early evening. It gets crowded, rowdy and the music is way too loud past 9pm. For a bar where I'd like to have a nice conversation with people, it's extremely unfriendly when it gets that late.I'm taking one star off for the price (so. expensive.) and the noise level past 9pm. Otherwise, this place has 5-star worthy drinks!!! Would love to visit the NY store to try their drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Employees Only - Singapore, Singapore. Tagliatelle with zucchini parmesan black olives
Photo of Employees Only - Singapore, Singapore. Aviation
Photo of Employees Only - Singapore, Singapore

86WMpx97IHIX-hf60LWzvQ.text: If you have been to New York and visited the EO there, you know what to expect: a perfect american bar with bar classics, infused boze and some dining.This bar is a copy of the original, including the "psyche" sign in the entreance window and the "beware..." over the bar. No experiments.While the bar is slioghtly smalle than the original, the drinks are the same. Jalapeno infised chartreuse and other self made ingredients are also availiable there as their well known food. If you want to be on the safe side when getting a drink, you will be fine here, if you want some more local style, you need to go elsewhere.Slightly more expensive thant the other SG bars.

DvqcxWZyL16F7jxr9HdjCw.text: Some of the best mixology in SG. Barman Evan is a trip and worth a good conversation. Rarely can you find a good conversationalist behind a bar in this city. Food, super good. Expensive, yes. Worth it? For sure. Always has an interesting, stylish crowd as well.

0wj5WyAO8sL53ULn8zgeuA.text: Wow, literally one of the worst service experiences I've ever had anywhere in the world. I had a number of gin-based drinks, but they were all kind of insipid and watered down. Food menu was boring, with no appetizers or sharing portions, making it really hard to order. Worst of all were the stuck-up servers, who kept trying to push us new drinks... and were so pushy they eventually ended up pushing us out of the bar.Honestly, I feel sorry for New Yorkers who have to put up with this kind of condescending service. If this is the best of NYC, the Village can keep it.

dRKffo0b63C8FuMRtz2trQ.text: Great place to hang, amazing drinks and Ben is the awesome bar tender!! Loved every moment.

photos.caption: Photo of Employees Only - Singapore, Singapore

kydSH5PQpgs18MAVLKjLgQ.text: I'm sorry to have to say this by EO NYC isn't as good as this spot. The bartenders at EO Singapore are incredible. We stopped into EO to have a drink and I immediately noticed from the sidewalk the curtains just like in NYC. The art deco decor is on point and they have most of the same drinks with a couple of other new favorites. One of the bartenders beat out his fellow coworkers in a competition with a drink called the Black diamond. It was the best drink I've had in a long time. The staff was unreal friendly. We're only in town for a short period of time 3 nights, but I'm making sure we swing back by one more time. Can't say enough good things.

ahjIX11kAJlt52JnC10vPA.text: Employees Only is a originally from NYC in the West Village, and on the most recent best bars of the world list, it is #4.  And it certainly doesn't disappoint.  But first a warning - like jekyl and hyde, the experience can be very different.  If you go early, expect a serene scene with some of the best cocktails on the island.  On ladies night, it can get pretty crazy with wall to wall people, but you will still get solid drinks...eventually :).  I had a chance to try 3 cocktails recently, and while they were classic cocktails, they were all so good - expertly executed with a generous serving.  My first drink was off of their menu -  the Billionaire Drink, which was a very tasty combo of Bourbon, lemon juice, grenadine and absinthe bitters (yum!).  I love the mix of bourbon and fresh lemon juice, and this drink exemplifies this well.  Next up, I had an old fashioned with my favorite rye whiskey - Michters.  Solid!  Finally, I tried a pisco sour which is very luscious with the egg whites and some freshly grated nutmeg.  The food menu is also very interesting with everything from salads and pastas to steak and rainbow trout!  Employees Only in NYC is well-known for being able to adapt to each customer.  In Singapore, I can also see the concept working here, although things can get pretty crazy late in night.

photos.caption: Photo of Employees Only - Singapore, Singapore. Lovely skylight which you may miss unless you are there early.
Photo of Employees Only - Singapore, Singapore. The bar
Photo of Employees Only - Singapore, Singapore. Solid Old Fashioned with Michters Rye Whiskey.
